_header: Saint Agnes that holy maid well young she began
Subjects: saints’ lives; Agnes, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Agnes in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEynt Anneis þe holi maide wel ȝong heo biganTo serui god
                    al miȝti to be cristenwomman…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þis was lo a uair myracle of seynt Anneis iwisNou god
                    ous bringe to þulke Ioie þat þis maide Inne is

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint anneys þe holy mayde wel ȝong ȝhe be ganto
                    serwin god & oure leuedy & ben cristin woman…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& saue vs alle fram dedly sinne þe whyle we beþ
                    alyue& bryng vs to þe blis þat ȝhe is in for his woundys
                    fyue

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Agnes þe holy Mayde wel sone heo by gonTo serue God
                    Almihti and to beo Cristene wommon…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þus þis maide seint Agneis brouȝhte hire lyf to
                    fyneAnd wende to þe Blisse of heuene aftur hire muchele
                    pyne

Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,

Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Agnes þe holi maide ful ȝong sche be ganffor to
                    serue god al myȝti & to be a cristen womman…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…Þis was a fair meracle of seint agnes I wisNow god
                    bringe us to þat ioye þat þis maydyn inne is

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[S]eint Agneis þat holy maide swiþe ȝong biganTo
                    serue god almiȝte & to be cristene womman…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…þus þis maide S[eint] agneys broȝte hure lif to
                    ende& to þe ioye of heuene after hure pine gan wende
OxfCCC431.Note: Portion of text lost due to mutilation of leaves.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayne Agnete þe haly virgyn ful erly scho beganTo serue gode
                    in cristen laghe & was a gude womanScho was bot xiij ȝer olde to
                    dede when scho was broghtffor þe lufe of Ihesu Criste þat hir ful
                    ful dere hade broght…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…& þus þis maiden saynt agnes died in grete
                    tormentgod brynge vs al to þat ioy þat hir sauele to
                    wente

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Seint Anneis þe holy maide wel ȝong by ganTo serui god
                    almiȝti to be cristen womman…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…þis mayde seint anneys þus broȝte hure lif to
                    fineAnd wende to þe Ioie of heuene after þe muchel
                    pine
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.19.

CamFitzMc128.First Lines:
Saynt Agnes the holy virgin ful soon she beganTo serve god
                    almyȝty and be a gode woman…
CamFitzMc128.Last Lines:
…That man ne myȝt for his fax noȝt of hir body seeA
                    hows that served for bordel ther was riȝt besyde…
CamFitzMc128.Note: Stanzas 1-51 only; ends imperfectly due to loss of folios.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Seint Anneys þe holy mayde wel ȝong by ganTo seruyn god
                    al miȝty & to beo a cristene womman…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Now god ffor þe loue of hure vs lete such goednesse
                    wynneÞat we mowe to þat ioye come þat ȝeo ybrouȝt
                    is ynne

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Agnes þat maide wel Yong heo by ganTo seruy god al
                    myȝty & be cristen womman…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…þys is a fayre myracle of seint agnes ywysGod ous brynge
                    to þe ioie þer þat heo ys

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
SEint Anneys þis holy mayde wel ȝong sche by ganTo serue
                    god all Myȝty & to be a cristen womman…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
… þis was lo a feyre miracle of seynt anneys ywysNou god
                    vs brynge to þat ioye þat þis mayde in ys
BLAdd10301.Note:
Last two lines appear at the top of f. 16 after scribe had left 6 lines
                    blank at bottom f. 15v.

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEynt Anneys þat holimayde wel ȝong ȝhe biganto serue god almiȝti to be cristene womman…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þis was lo a vair miracle of seint anneis ywisnou god ous bringe to þilke ioe þat þis Inne is
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum vii” added to right margin by later hand (f. 9).

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint agnes þe maide wel ȝong heo biganTo serue god al miȝti & be cristene womman…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Þis was a fair miracle of seint agnes iwisGod vs bringe to þat ioie þer þat maiden is

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEynt Anneye þe holi mayde wel ȝonge ȝe byganeTo seruin god & Seint marie & to be cristin womman…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Þis was lo auaire myracle of seynt agneis ywisNou god ous bringe to þulke Ioye þer ȝeo in is

BLEge2891.First Lines: …Hi leueþ ȝoure false godes for hi nabbeþ poer nonOnes to meoue of þe stude namore þan aston…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þis was lo fair moracle of Seint Anneis iwisNou god us bringe to þulke ioie þat þis maide Inne is

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Agnes þe holy virgyn ful soone she biganTo serue god
                    almyȝty & to be a gode woman…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…And þus þis mayde saynt Agnes broȝt hir lyf to
                    endeAnd god vs bringe to þat ioye þat hir soule con to wende
                    Amen

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Seint Agnes the holy maide wel ȝong she biganTo serue god
                    almighty and be cristen woman…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
Thus the mayde seint Agnes broughte hir lyf to fyneAnd wente to the
                    ioye of heuene after hir pyne Amen
